Watching John Cassavetes film, Opening Night, I was reminded of something that Quentin Tarantino said once in an interview about personal experience in being a creator. He said:
“I don’t think there’s any such thing as this has happened to me; therefore, I should make this movie. It’s about what you feel inside and what inspires you creatively.”
These are words we all need to strive for. Who is the artist then? The man/woman in the mirror

Besides not having $50 million dollars like nowadays films do, I liked this movie

Movie about two Australian girls--Debbie (Nell Schofield) and Sue (Sue Knight)--and what happens when they become girlfriends of two surly bikers--Casey (Lynn Savage) and Linda (Blue). As a story of circumstance becomes a story of lesbian love, callous treatment is replaced with emotional bonding, the knife slow motion turns to the flesh, but nobody really dies.
